title: SFH visits Kwun Tong District (with photos)
content_text:
p>
	The Secretary for Food and Health, Dr Ko Wing-man, visited Kwun Tong today 
	(July 18) to learn more about the Kwun Tong Town Centre Project and the 
	provision of mental health services in the district. He also met with 
	District Councillors to listen to their views and concerns on various local 
	matters. Accompanied by the Chairman of Kwun Tong District Council, Mr Chan 
	Chung-bun, and the District Officer (Kwun Tong), Mr Gilford Law, Dr Ko

toured the Urban Renewal Authority's (URA) Kwun Tong Resource Centre, where 
	he was briefed by the Director of the URA Kwun Tong Project, Dr Ernest Lee, 
	on the latest developments of the Kwun Tong Town Centre Project. They also 
	exchanged views on the planned provision of medical and environmental 
	hygiene services in the town centre following its redevelopment. Dr Ko then proceeded to the Medical Health Association of Hong Kong, a 
	non-profit-making social service organisation dedicated to promoting mental 
	health and enhancing public awareness of various issues related to mental

health and enhancing public awareness of various issues related to mental 
	health. Dr Ko was pleased to learn that the Association has been providing 
	comprehensive rehabilitation services for mentally handicapped people and 
	people recovering from mental illness, including residential services, 
	day-time training, vocational rehabilitation training and community support 
	services. Dr Ko also expressed his gratitude to the Association for its 
	efforts in promoting mental health services in areas such as medicine and 
	health, education, social communication, leisure, entertainment and sports,

health, education, social communication, leisure, entertainment and sports, so as to meet the needs of mental patients and mentally handicapped persons. Before concluding his visit, Dr Ko met with district councillors and exchanged views on how to further improve the district’s hospital and clinic services, as well as on the food safety and environmental hygiene situation. Ends/Friday, July 18, 2014
Issued at HKT 19:45
